column1: # Example: Sample Claims Data for Training
# Format: CSV with historical claims and expert decisions
# To create your own training data
column2: export historical claims with these columns:

column9: Clinical Assessment: E11.9 (Type 2 diabetes without complications) and I10 (Essential hypertension) are valid diagnoses. CPT 99213 (Office visit, established patient, moderate complexity) is appropriate for managing these chronic conditions. Medical necessity is confirmed for routine monitoring of diabetes and hypertension. No coding concerns identified.
column10: DECISION: APPROVED. Office visit for chronic disease management is covered under policy POL-12345. Diagnosis codes are on the covered conditions list. CPT 99213 is within allowed procedures. Claim amount $150.00 is reasonable. No prior authorization required for routine office visits. Process at 80% coverage per policy terms. Patient responsibility: ~$30 coinsurance.

column9: Clinical Assessment: J45.909 (Unspecified asthma, uncomplicated) is a valid diagnosis. CPT 99214 (Office visit, established patient, detailed) is appropriate for asthma management requiring moderate medical decision making. Medical necessity confirmed for asthma control assessment. Coding is specific and appropriate.
column10: DECISION: APPROVED. Asthma management covered under policy POL-67890. J45.909 is a covered respiratory condition. CPT 99214 appropriate for the level of service. Claim amount $200.00 within expected range. No prior authorization needed. Process at 90% coverage (preferred provider). Patient responsibility: ~$20.

column9: Clinical Assessment: M79.3 (Panniculitis, unspecified) with CPT 20610 (Arthrocentesis, aspiration and/or injection; major joint). CONCERN: Coding mismatch. Panniculitis is a skin/subcutaneous condition, while 20610 is for joint procedures. Medical necessity questionable without supporting documentation of joint pathology. Recommend reviewing clinical notes for appropriate diagnosis code.
column10: DECISION: PENDING. Coding inconsistency identified between diagnosis (panniculitis) and procedure (joint injection). Medical necessity unclear without additional documentation. Request: 1) Clinical notes from visit, 2) Correct diagnosis code for joint condition, 3) Indication for joint injection. Cannot approve without clarification of medical necessity.

column9: Clinical Assessment: Z01.419 (Encounter for gynecological examination without abnormal findings) with CPT 99385 (Initial comprehensive preventive medicine, age 18-39). Codes are clinically appropriate for routine preventive care. Medical necessity confirmed for annual wellness visit. No concerns.
column10: DECISION: APPROVED. Preventive care covered under policy POL-22222 per ACA requirements. Annual wellness visit is a covered benefit at 100% (no cost-share). Z01.419 and CPT 99385 are standard preventive codes. Claim amount $450.00 is reasonable for comprehensive exam. Process at 100% coverage.

column9: Clinical Assessment: Z23 (Encounter for immunization) with CPT 90471 (Immunization administration, one vaccine). Codes are appropriate for vaccine administration. Medical necessity confirmed for preventive immunization. Standard coding for vaccination encounter.
column10: DECISION: DENIED. Policy POL-33333 does not include immunization coverage for adults. Z23/90471 are preventive vaccine codes not covered under this plan. Reason: Policy is catastrophic coverage only, excludes preventive benefits. Patient is responsible for full amount. Recommend checking if patient has supplemental preventive coverage.
